title: Can we PLEASE admit Nasus is a problem?
body:
I don't know about the rest of you, but whenever I'm playing top in solo queue and have to lane against {{champion:75}} , I become overwhelmed with frustration.


*Because he's absolute hell to play against.*


Let's go through his problems:

-Unlike other perma-scaling late-game tanks like {{champion:14}} and {{champion:412}}, {{champion:75}} 's damage never falls off, and instead **becomes even stronger.**

-Unlike other perma-scaling late-game damage dealers like {{champion:69}} and {{champion:45}}, {{champion:75}} never becomes a glass cannon, and instead **gains a ton of survivability.**

-Unlike the aforementioned champions, who all have meager laning phases in order to make up for their bonkers late game potential, {{champion:75}} really only has problems until he finishes his first item.

-Unlike the aforementioned champions, who don't draw an irregular amount of attention during laning phase, {{champion:75}} HAS to be denied, and even if you do so, you will eventually **have** to go back to base, allowing Nasus to get the 50 stacks he needs to get rolling.

-{{champion:75}}  only needs 50 stacks to get rolling, and gains **3 stacks per minion kill.**

-All of the weaknesses of the immobile melee damage-tank are solved with {{champion:75}}'s kit: free lifesteal, free **90% slow**, free armor reduction, free damage, and free tankiness. Therefore, he can build full tank, and still have an ungodly amount of damage and utility.

-**90% slow for 5 seconds.** This shit needs to be changed **ASAP.** Like, there are arguments that can be made against my other points, but this shit is broken.

replies.body: Nasus can be beaten. It's all on how your team plays. If you have a good team he isn't a problem if you have a bad team well, welcome to the club.
Make his slow join the .75 second club. {{champion:45}}
His slow takes time to take full effect, already. It starts as like a 20% slow and then ramps to 90% over 5 seconds. the 90% portion only lasts about .5 second.

The 95% slow is not something a good Nasus will have before level 13.  He is also so easily kited that you can out-wait the duration and then escape.  Or just use X champion's escape / gap closer to completely kite him during the slow anyways.

After reading the op, I got a lot of salt but not actually good arguments.  You've tried to inflate the worst parts of his kit for his opponent while ignoring all of his weaknesses.  

"Extreme utility, one of the best crowd control ults in the game, a permaslow you never have to turn off, large amounts of AOE damage over time, insane temporary vision, and passive gold gain.  OMG it's so freaking op please nerf ASHE IMMEDIATELY."

> [{quoted}](name=mjack33,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kAZJVZfe,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-03-11T08:50:14.817+0000)
>
> The 95% slow is not something a good Nasus will have before level 13.  He is also so easily kited that you can out-wait the duration and then escape.  Or just use X champion's escape / gap closer to completely kite him during the slow anyways.
> 
> After reading the op, I got a lot of salt but not actually good arguments.  You've tried to inflate the worst parts of his kit for his opponent while ignoring all of his weaknesses.  
> 
> "Extreme utility, one of the best crowd control ults in the game, a permaslow you never have to turn off, large amounts of AOE damage over time, insane temporary vision, and passive gold gain.  OMG it's so freaking op please nerf ASHE IMMEDIATELY."

as far as i know, nasus builds triforce and merc threads, he is actually surprisingly fast without the slow and he only needs to Q you 1-2 times. lets not even get on his ability to destroy objectives. I think it is okay to have strong late game champions but he needs some type of weakness lategame

> [{quoted}](name=Malix Farwin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kAZJVZfe,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-03-11T12:00:16.554+0000)
>
> as far as i know, nasus builds triforce and merc threads, he is actually surprisingly fast without the slow and he only needs to Q you 1-2 times. lets not even get on his ability to destroy objectives. I think it is okay to have strong late game champions but he needs some type of weakness lategame

Really? Because he doesn't have a strong lategame. Sure, he technically CAN scale forever, but his scaling doesn't matter when late game is primarily teamfights where he gets kited to death.

If you want to beat Nasus, force him off the minions in laning phase AND DON'T push to his turret. Pushing to his turret is literal free Q stacks for Nasus, and if he can't autoattack minions he can't sustain at all.

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Dusteon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kAZJVZfe,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-11T12:38:41.855+0000)
>
> Really? Because he doesn't have a strong lategame. Sure, he technically CAN scale forever, but his scaling doesn't matter when late game is primarily teamfights where he gets kited to death.
> 
> If you want to beat Nasus, force him off the minions in laning phase AND DON'T push to his turret. Pushing to his turret is literal free Q stacks for Nasus, and if he can't autoattack minions he can't sustain at all.

The problem with your logic is that you assume that he will be kited in TEAMFIGHTS. his team also has cc and he only needs to q you 1-2 times. Late game he has no weakness, now i could see your point if teamfights didn't happen much late game but any competent team would always be together by that point. Another thing is, is laning phase sucks only if he is constantly getting ganked by which case he could just turret farm while the enemy jg waste time top lane and ally jg can camp bot and mid. His early game is not nearly weak enough to balance out his late game, at the very least his lifesteal has to go.

Fun fact: Nasus is a shitty tank if he isn't Qing something to stay alive. He also has no escape besides a single target slow.

Most adcs can easily build BotRK and LW (which they should build anyways.) and sell their AS boots for boots of swiftness to ignore his slow.

> [{quoted}](name=JJ H0G,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kAZJVZfe,comment-id=000000000001,timestamp=2015-03-11T13:12:36.205+0000)
>
> Fun fact: Nasus is a shitty tank if he isn't Qing something to stay alive. He also has no escape besides a single target slow.
> 
> Most adcs can easily build BotRK and LW (which they should build anyways.) and sell their AS boots for boots of swiftness to ignore his slow.

I rarely see a nasus 1v1 someone until he has farmed enough to 2 shot them in which case the wither has enough points in it to make a difference. IF his steadily rising winrate is not enough of an indicator that he is starting to be a problem, will we have to wait till he gets used in the LCS to admit it.
How I beat nasus = trundle.
Teemo ..... Frozen Mallet.... ByBy susaN.   All you need on any ranged champ is a frozen mallet and nasus is going nowhere.

> [{quoted}](name=TG Death Machine,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kAZJVZfe,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-03-11T09:02:55.240+0000)
>
> Teemo ..... Frozen Mallet.... ByBy susaN.   All you need on **any ranged champ **is a frozen mallet and nasus is going nowhere.

Because ranged tops don't fuck over most top laners..This argument can be used for any ranged top.

True to a point. Teemo specifically counters Nasus due not only to range, but because his Poison rapidly outscales Nasus' Lifesteal. Once you throw in mushrooms that slow AND poison, Nasus has a very hard time. Lucky for Nasus, Teemo top isn't as prevalent as it once was.
While true, the main reason is the blind. If Nasus is constantly missing his Qs because he can't see, he can't farm up his damage. A nasus with low stacks is an almost useless creature.
Really, Teemo counters Nasus because Blind means that that 500 damage Q won't hit you for a couple extra seconds, which is all the time you need to out damage him early.
That thing lasts 5s. i.e. He'll hit you right when that blind ends.

It isn't about blocking it entirely, early on when you are trying to bully him out of lane you can blind and then trade several hits during your blind, and even if he gets one Q off on you, you are still significantly out damaging him because his main damage is blocked for most of the trade.

Early on, Teemo has 0.75 AS while blind lasts 1s, so unlikely you can trade more than one hit.

If Nasus gets 1 Q on you, you'll lose the trade. It easily takes out 25% HP with a single Q @100 stacks (33 CS)

His "main dmg" isn't blocked. Blind buys you at most 2s (if you maxed it) while Siphon lasts 5s, unless you find a way to get him off you (which is virtually impossible due to wither overwriting Move Quickly), he'll hit it once blind ends.

I'm not talking 33 stacks, I'm talking about forcing him out of lane so he still has only 6-7 stacks at that point. A Teemo who freezes the lane on his side (like anyone against a Nasus should) and blinds Nasus whenever he is about to last hit or AA trade can *heavily* punish a Nasus before about level 4, at which point the blind is mostly useful for making him miss creeps (because it doesn't matter if the Q buff lasts for 5 seconds if the creep dies before he can hit it again).

And hows about nasus hitting another creep once blind expires? Blind can make people miss cannon minions, as ive been doing plenty of times, but to completely miss every cs is impossible.

Sure, you can punish him pre-6, before he has specter crowl, but then what? post-6, his Q oneshot minions at half health who isn't likely to die before blind expire. Wither makes it impossible to kite, also keep in mind their jungler might intervene, as any sane jungle should, and wither + gank = flash or dead.

Freezing lane also makes it difficult to clear the pink at river, which denies you vision, and open lane for ganks.

Guaranteeing him to miss 1-2 out of 6 every wave slows down a good Nasus a lot early on and often can have a very large impact on his scaling speed. Of course he can go on to use it on another minion, but every time you force him to miss 1 CS, you are guaranteeing that he will take that much longer to really start rolling. It isn't supposed to hard counter him to oblivion or deny every creep (because that would make Teemo hard counter anything that has to last hit for farm) it just is doubly effective since you can deny him access to more creeps than most other champions.

TL;DR: it isn't about denying all of them, it is about denying more of them than most other champions can.
That's not the point of his argument. He's just saying that buying Frozen Mallet will help a ranged champ defeat Nasus as opposed to how the OP argues that Nasus is rather unstoppable.

> [{quoted}](name=Kawizz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kAZJVZfe,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2015-03-11T09:24:23.381+0000)
>
> Because ranged tops don't fuck over most top laners..This argument can be used for any ranged top.

but most melee top laners have gapcloser(s)

{{champion:105}} {{champion:266}} {{champion:120}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:150}} {{champion:14}}

> [{quoted}](name=Xtremey,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kAZJVZfe,comment-id=000300000002,timestamp=2015-03-11T14:59:57.815+0000)
>
> but most melee top laners have gapcloser(s)
> 
> {{champion:105}} {{champion:266}} {{champion:120}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:150}} {{champion:14}}

*sigh* 

{{champion:105}} Shitting on his ap gave birth/rise to ad fizz being better where he dominates top.

{{champion:266}}  Lol pls.

{{champion:120}}  Being used more as a lane bully and dat tp gank plus just overall safer in top.

{{champion:39}} Nerf irelia.

{{champion:54}} Requires a target and his ult is a skillshot.

{{champion:150}} Not melee unless in Mega gnar but even then has massive utility plus damage which got him nerfed but still very strong.

{{champion:14}}  E spam for days. Only gapcloser is on his ult which you can easily fuck up.

Ironically, I'd rather play against these champions top then Nasus sitting under tower any day farming his Q because he has absurd sustain with passive/flask.
I love getting a lane against Nasus. It's free kills when being in lane with him. I always take Exhaust with me though and rush a botrk if melee champ.

If you freeze your lane nasus has a really hard time even getting exp depending on the champion. He can't force you to stop freezing unless you already fed him. It also puts him at a huge risk of being ganked.

Not to argue, but just to offer, It seems it's generally Nasus who freezes lane so he can farm more easily. Nasus has extremely good poke resistance due to his natural tankiness and life steal and extremely good gank survivability due to Wither and Spirit Fire (spirit fire being a deterrent while wither is the escape).

well it depends. When you face nasus you don't really want to be pushing into his turret. Nasus tends to push harder then most champions because of his q farm. As nasus unless you are pretty fed you can't just freeze lane because most champions that go top can force him to stop. His lifesteal and tankyness are not that great until at least his first item. If he never gets going or has to lose hp for every cs he gets it doesn't matter how good his poke resistance or natural tankyness is because he will always be behind you.
I didn't mean to paint him as unbeatable. Just that he is better than many at planting his feet and farming his lane.
That is true. However the reverse is also true. He is worse then most at stopping other people from playing defensive. So basically when up against a nasus make sure the wave doesn't push towards him

I can agree with that. Though a well-placed Spirit Fire can be a handy poking tool.

I think one of the worst experiences I had against a Nasus was when he went JUNGLE. Our jungler was very passive and I was busy facing Irelia @ top. So no one noticed the absence of Nasus ALL GAME.

Suddenly, he bursts from his jungle with 500 stacks and single handedly wins the game...

I was impressed. I'd never seen it before and it was exactly the right role for Nasus on that team. His allies didn't NEED him to at least go even in lane.

Once we started getting ahead and had one of their inhibs pushed, that's when he revealed himself. We deserved that loss. I didn't see it coming, and I applaud that player for thinking outside the box.
Jungle nasus was big in season 3. Before that he was considered a trash pick. He actually received several nerfs because of how strong his jungle was.
Heh. Well it worked out for this player. I should try it out. I've always played him top, myself.
not as good anymore because of the lifesteal nerfs but still good.
It's not good anymore due to the jungle changes you have literally half as much available q farm as compared to last season
that too.

Don't it's a trash jungle pick again. The changes to the jungle at the start of this season doubled the spawn timers on camps compared to what it was when it was good. Meaning you have half the potential Q stacks available assa to when this was good. Back last season if all you did was farm jung which is what i suspect the nasus in question did. It used to be easy to hit 300-400 stacks in 15 minutes. Now you would be lucky to hit even 200

> -All of the weaknesses of the immobile melee damage-tank are solved with {{champion:75}}'s kit: free lifesteal, free **90% slow**, free armor reduction, free damage, and free tankiness. Therefore, he can build full tank, and still have an ungodly amount of damage and utility.
> 
> -**90% slow for 5 seconds.** This shit needs to be changed **ASAP.** Like, there are arguments that can be made against my other points, but this shit is broken.

Before I begin, I'm not going to argue Nasus is a balanced champion or not. Mostly because these boards like to condemn those who like playing those champions quite often and I like to think of myself as someone who likes to play Nasus when they get the chance to when I top lane. I like playing him top and jungle. So I'm not going to say that he's fine or whatever because I know I will be condemned for that.

I don't think you understand what the term "Free" means. He has free Lifesteal, yes but the rest of what you've stated has mana costs. Otherwise we can argue that everyone has free damage in their kits. Nasus spells (aside from his Q), do cost quite a bit of mana. Also the aforementioned champions you so pointed out all have **hard** CC, even if delayed or situational. Not only that, but Cassiopeia and Veigar are ranged with zoning tools. 

What I will say is that I do find it weird that Nasus can gain stacks on Towers and Wards. Then again I also find it weird that players can lifesteal from wards as well.

nasus has some pretty easy counters, main thing is to not feed him and let him lane freely. essentially you need a good jung to gank him if he ever pushes, if he freezes lane and farms then you need a 3 man tower gank. he neeeeeeedds to be shut down early asap.

You have to shut him down early. All those "problems" you talk about are exactly what he's intended to do. He is supposed to be pretty much the best champion in the game late game (except, maybe, for hyper-carries). If you let him free farm, you will lose. Working as intended.

I just don't think his Q should work on towers.  It can be really frustrating when a Nasus who is just MODERATELY fed, split pushes top lane.  With his ulti, whither, if you send any kind of squishy top to deal with him he will just dive you and kill you with 2 Q's, but you can't ignore him either because he takes the tower in 4 Q's.  If you send someone tanky, he will just ulti, ignore the tank and take the tower anyway then walk away.

There are SEVERAL ways to not give {{champion:75}} the late game he desires but it will require your jungler. If you're having issues with him in lane that is because you are picking horrible champions to play against him. For instance, if you play {{champion:69}}  you will DUMPSTER him with no issues at all. Also, {{champion:58}} destroys {{champion:75}} . Here's the thing, Nasus NEEDS to get to late game. If your team pressures him early, you wont allow him to stack efficiently. The one issue with {{champion:75}} , is his "W" Wither. That ability is a perma slow and you can't do much about it. Even if you buy a {{item:3140}}  to remove it, wait a few seconds and it'll be back on you. And out of this entire scaling post you forgot about {{champion:13}} . His late game is ridiculous if the person playing {{champion:13}} knows what he/she is doing.

{{item:3009}} 

Why do people forget that this item exists? His slow won't do shit early-mid because of it.
we're not gonna adress the fact that no matter how hard you will equally duel him he's gonna like Q lifesteal from a minion?
don't duel him by minions? He also can't do shit if the enemy adc or other AA DPS champ gets fed, because they'll melt his ass faster than most other tanks.

This is the only reason Nasus IS picked.

He is a beast late game with a unique extremely long slow at the cost of having no way to escape or dash into a fight.
He is a problem if you let him free farm his q, the entire game, and you let him walk up to your carries, and q him.

Gank him shit tons. 

So sick of people not knowing what to do, I literally watched a fucking {{champion:58}} !!! Let {{champion:75}}  Get 700 Stacks by 20 mins. Honestly depressing, It's like people won't even try.
Exaggerations much?

Not at all, 700 stacks 20 mins. Vs a Ren.

At 25 mins Nas pushed down all three lane towers top, Then into the base and won the game.
